Gumdrop

Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http

HTTP/1.1 and HTTP/2 server implementation.

This package provides a full-featured HTTP server supporting both HTTP/1.1 and HTTP/2 protocols, with automatic protocol negotiation via ALPN (Application-Layer Protocol Negotiation) for TLS connections.

Key Components

  • HTTPServer - The main HTTP server that listens for connections and delegates to handlers
  • HTTPConnection - Handles a single HTTP connection, supporting both HTTP/1.1 and HTTP/2
  • Stream - Represents an HTTP/2 stream or HTTP/1.1 request/response pair
  • Headers - HTTP header collection

HTTP/2 Support

HTTP/2 features include:

  • Binary framing with multiplexed streams
  • HPACK header compression
  • Server push
  • Flow control per stream and connection
  • Stream prioritization

HTTP/2 frame parsing and writing is handled by the org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.h2 package, which provides a zero-allocation, callback-based API for frame handling.

Configuration Example


 <http-server id="https" port="443">
   <property name="keystore-file">/etc/gumdrop/keystore.p12</property>
   <property name="keystore-password">secret</property>
   <property name="handler">
     <file-handler document-root="/var/www"/>
   </property>
 </http-server>

Subpackages

  • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.client - HTTP client
  • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.file - Static file serving
  • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.h2 - HTTP/2 frame parsing and writing
  • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.hpack - HPACK compression
  • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.websocket - WebSocket support

Telemetry

When telemetry is configured, the HTTP server provides:

  • Distributed tracing with W3C Trace Context propagation
  • Request/response metrics (latency, size, status codes)
  • Connection and stream metrics
Author:
Chris Burdess
See Also:
HTTPServer, HTTPConnection, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.websocket
  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    HTTPRequestHandler
    Handler for HTTP request events on a single stream.
    HTTPRequestHandlerFactory
    Factory for creating HTTPRequestHandler instances.
    HTTPResponseState
    State interface for sending an HTTP response.
    WebSocketEventHandler
    Handler for WebSocket lifecycle events.
    WebSocketSession
    A WebSocket session for sending messages to the peer.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ContentTypes
    Fallback to discover reasonable Content-Type for a resource.
    DefaultHTTPRequestHandler
    Default implementation of HTTPRequestHandler with empty methods.
    DefaultWebSocketEventHandler
    A default implementation of WebSocketEventHandler with empty methods.
    Header
    An HTTP header.
    Headers
    A collection of HTTP headers with convenience methods for header access.
    HTTPAuthenticationMethods
    Constants for HTTP authentication methods.
    HTTPAuthenticationProvider
    Abstract base class for HTTP authentication providers.
    HTTPAuthenticationProvider.AuthenticationResult
    Authentication result containing outcome and principal information.
    HTTPConnection
    Connection handler for the HTTP protocol.
    HTTPConstants
    HTTP/1.1 constants.
    HTTPDateFormat
    HTTP date formatter and parser.
    HTTPServer
    Connection factory for HTTP connections on a given port.
    HTTPServerMetrics
    OpenTelemetry metrics for HTTP servers.
    PriorityAwareHTTPConnection
    HTTP connection with HTTP/2 stream priority optimization.
    PriorityAwareHTTPConnector
    HTTP connector with HTTP/2 stream priority optimization support.
    PriorityAwareHTTPServer
    HTTP connector with HTTP/2 stream priority optimization support.
    StreamPriorityScheduler
    HTTP/2 stream priority-aware scheduler for optimal resource allocation.
    StreamPriorityTree
    Manages HTTP/2 stream priority dependency tree for optimal resource allocation.
    StreamPriorityTree.PriorityNode
    Priority node representing a stream in the dependency tree.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    HTTPStatus
    Symbolic enumeration of HTTP status codes.
    HTTPVersion
    Enum of possible HTTP versions.
